game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class containing a "map" of all the pieces involved in a game of Connect Four
    Author:
    Daniel McCann

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int boardWidth,
             int boardHeight)
        Constructor for the game board. Creates a 2d array of characters, where empty characters are asterisks
        Parameters:
        boardWidth - takes the intended width of the game board
        boardHeight - takes the intended height of the game board

    • Method Detail

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()

      • getMap

        public char[][] getMap()
        Public getter for the map
        Returns:
        Returns a character array representing the game board

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • theirTurn

        public int theirTurn(int col)
        Method for recording the enemy players turn.
        Parameters:
        col - col recieves an index for the column number.
        The piece will seek the bottom most row of the column, where no pieces already are
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if the insert turn was unsuccessful (This should never happen)
        Returns -10 if the column is full of other pieces
        Returns the row that the piece was placed in if column was valid

      • myTurn

        public int myTurn(int col)
        Method for recording the players turn.
        Parameters:
        col - col recieves an index for the column number.
        The piece will seek the bottom most row of the column, where no pieces already are
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if the insert turn was unsuccessful (This should never happen, if it does, something is wrong).
        Returns -10 if the column is full of other pieces.
        If the insert was successful, then the row where the piece landed in is returned.

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin(int row,
                        int col)
        Method that takes the coordinates of the grid to check win conditions on
        Parameters:
        row - the row of the piece in question (Can be taken from the myTurn or theirTurn methods)
        col - the column of the piece in question
        Returns:
        returns true if the specified coordinate satisfies at least one win condition
        returns false if the specified coordinate is not a win, or if the row is invalid, which happens when the myTurn()/theirTurn() methods fail.
